message.entry: The Writable field must contain a scalar logical.
The Offset field must be a real scalar number.
The Offset field must contain a finite, nonnegative integral value.
The Format field specified is invalid.
The Repeat field must contain a real scalar number.
The Repeat field must contain a positive integral value, or Inf.
Filename must be a character vector.
Cannot access file "{0}": {1}.
Values assigned to the Data field must have the same class as the Data field.
Complex values may not be assigned to Data field or its subfields.
Illegal subscripted assignment to Data field of memmapfile object.
Param/value pairs must come in pairs.
Cannot modify Data field because Writable field is set to false.
Property must be a character vector or cell array of character vectors.
Memmapfile objects cannot be converted to structures.
Illegal format, offset, or repeat. Accessing the Data field given the specified format, offset, and repeat values would cause an unaligned address exception.
File "{0}" is not large enough to map with the current format, offset, and repeat values.
In an assignment M.DATA = N, the number of elements in N and M.DATA must be the same.
Cannot change the size of the Data field via subscripted assignment. The size of the Data field is determined by the Repeat and Format fields.
When the Data field of a memmapfile object is a structure, it may not be replaced by assignment.
Values assigned to subfields of the Data field must have the same class as the subfield.
In an assignment M.DATA(I).FIELD = N, the number of elements in N and M.DATA(I).FIELD must be the same.
Cannot change the size of a subfield of the Data field via subscripted assignment. The sizes of subfields of the Data field are determined by the Format field.
Parameter at input {0,number,integer} must be a character vector.
Parameter "{0}" is unrecognized.
Memmapfile objects may not be subscripted using ().
Memmapfile objects may not be subscripted using '{}'.
A subscripting operation on the Data field attempted to create a comma-separated list. The memmapfile class does not support the use of comma-separated lists when subscripting.
Memmapfile objects cannot be concatenated.
Empty memmapfile objects cannot be created.
